title: Can Cass get a clear indication that target is poisoned?
body:
I'm sure Im not the only one who waits to be sure my target is actually poisoned when I barely landed my Q. Can Cass get a clear indicator that the target is poisoned so she can react quicker?

Also, a duration timer of the poison would help. 

These are not buffs numbers wise, just more helpful info to allow players to make better decisions within the tight window they have.

I've been in lane low on health and playing it safe hoping to land my Q. Sometime it just barely hits the target, but I can't afford to not be sure because I'm low. 

The clarity would make a difference by 0.5 -1 seconds in my reaction. That extra reaction time can add 1 or 2 more E in my attack. When dealing with team fights where there is a ton of spell effects happening or target are clumped together, you need to know who is poisoned and who is not.
